Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a relic or spell supply pile. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player focuses one of their breaches.
Flavour: "I know it's powerful, but I kind of don't want to touch it." - Talix

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a supply pile that costs 7$ or more. These cards cost players 1$ less to gain.
Flavour: "I do not like to be restrained, even by choice. Let us end this quickly." - Soskel

Effect: After a player finishes resolving their ability, that player deals 2 damage.
Flavour: "It's like it's literally woven out of aether. Makes my skin all tingly." - Razra

Effect: When a player opens a breach, that player gains 1 charge. At the start of any player's turn, if that player has no closed breaches, that player gains 1 charge.
Flavour: "From the stories my father told me, I am glad all we have left of this monster are bones." - Sahala

Effect: When a player opens a breach, that player deals 2 damage.
Flavour: "Life always grows back stronger." - Inco

Effect: After a player finishes resolving their ability, any player may destroy a card in hand.
Flavour: "Then, I destroy what is unnecessary. First, I channel." - Nook

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a spell or relic supply pile. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, they deal 2 damage.
Flavour: "I read about Rageborne in the archives. We have grown much since then." - Mazra

Effect: When the last card in a supply pile is gained or destroyed, any player deals 6 damage.
Flavour: "Does holding this make anyone else feel hungry?" - Razra

Effect: When the last card in a supply pile is gained or destroyed, any player gains 3 charges.
Flavour: "What a powerful artifact! An entire flood inside one tiny finger." - Gygar

Effect: Once per turn during any player's main phase, that player may spend 4$ to focus each player's IV breach.
Flavour: "Our true strength is not in treasures, but in numbers." - Gygar

Effect: When the last card in a supply pile is gained or destroyed, any player gains 3 life.
Flavour: "It resembles a root, yes, but it is unnatural. The forest rejects is." - Inco

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a supply pile that costs 4$ or more. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player gains a charge.
Flavour: "All mages are connected. We draw from the same source of power." - Sahala

Effect: When a player opens a breach, that player may destroy a card in hand.
Flavour: "Focus your energy. Clarify. Use only what is vital." - Taqren

Effect: After a player finishes resolving their ability, any ally gains a charge.
Flavour: "One for you, one for me!" - Claudia

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a supply pile that costs 4$ or more. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player gains 1 life.
Flavour: "What once took everything from us now gives back." - Taqren

Effect: When a player gains life, they gain an additional 1 life.
Flavour: "You definitely said edible, right Inco?" - Talix

Effect: When a player deals 6 or more damage to the nemesis with a single spell, add a power token to this card. At the start of the nemesis turn, the nemesis suffers damage equal to the number of tokens on this card.
Flavour: "Like the Void itself, all-consuming and inevitable." - Qu

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a spell supply pile that costs 6$ or more. Those spells deal 2 additional damage when cast.
Flavour: "This one packs a punch!" - Rhia

Effect: When a player opens a breach, any ally draws a card.
Flavour: "Even a chipped off piece of a Nameless can create enormous power." - Xaxos

Effect: When Gravehold gains life, Gravehold gains an additional 1 life.
Flavour: "The aether of energy and the aether of life are actually one and the same! We are the world we live in." - Ilya

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a spell supply pile that costs 5$ or less. Those spells deal 1 additional damage when cast.
Flavour: "An infection can fell a beast just as surely as any knife." - Kel

Effect: After a player finishes resolving their ability, any ally draws a card.
Flavour: "I'm beginning to grasp the importance of teamwork." - Ohat

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a gem supply pile. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player gains 1 charge.
Flavour: "Minerals are a girl's best friend." - Cairna

Effect: Once per turn during any player's main phase, that player may spend 3$ to have each player gain a charge.
Flavour: "Focus. Breathe. Expand your mind." - Lucien

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a supply pile that costs 7$ or more. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player gains 2 life.
Flavour: "It doesn't look tasty, but the effects are hard to ignore." - Reth

Effect: Once per turn after a player plays their second relic, any ally draws a card.
Flavour: "Void essence and aether are two sides of the same coin. Each impacts the other. I am living proof." - Qu

Effect: When a player becomes exhausted, do not resolve any on-exhaust effects. The players do not lose when all players are exhausted.
Flavour: "I wonder, sometimes. Can I truly die?" - Lost

Effect: When a player gains a card that costs 7$ or more, add a power token to this card. At the start of the nemesis turn, if the nemesis has exactly one turn order card in the turn order discard pile, the nemesis suffers damage equal to the number of tokens on this card.
Flavour: "I am not so old yet that I cannot stand up for humanity." - Z'hana

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a spell or supply pile that costs 6$ or more. These cards cost players 1$ less to gain.
Flavour: "Experience is the most importance factor in a battle, but I would never turn my back on a powerful tool." - Taqren

Effect: When you gain a spell, gain 1 life.
Flavour: "Flourish, like flowers in the rain." - Inco

Effect: At the start of your turn, gain 1$ that can only be used to gain relics. When you gain a relic, you may place it on top of your deck.
Flavour: "It's always good to keep a few relics on you. They come in handy." - Rhia

Effect: At the start of your first turn of the game, focus each of your closed breaches once.
Flavour: "The power flows through me." - Gygar

Effect: At the start of your first turn of the game, gain a card that costs 4$ or less.
Flavour: "Fascinating. I cannot wait to study how these function in greater detail." - Mazra

Effect: When you cast two or more spells during your casting phase, gain 2$.
Flavour: "Fire to fire. Aether to aether." - Lost

Effect: Spells you cast that cost 2$ or more deal 1 additional damage.
Flavour: "Hit 'em where it hurts." - Talix

Effect: If you have no closed breaches, spells you cast deal 2 additional damage.
Flavour: "I haven't felt power like this since I left the Void." - Qu

Effect: When you deal damage to the nemesis with a spell, that spell deals 1 additional damage.
Flavour: "You deal with the little ones. I'm going after the big guy." - Razra

Effect: Once per turn, when you cast a spell that costs 6$ or more, gain 2 charges.
Flavour: "A noble title means little if I cannot protect my people." - Soskel

Effect: When you play a gem that costs 5$ or more, gain an additional 1$.
Flavour: "This gives me all kinds of wonderfully dangerous ideas for new gadgets!" - Claudia

Effect: At the start of your first turn of the game, gain 3$.
Flavour: "Gems. Another perk to treasure hunting." - Gygar

Effect: Once per turn when you focus or open a breack, gain 1 charge.
Flavour: "This tugging at my magic. I have felt this before." - Nook

Effect: At the end of your draw phase, you may discard one card in hand and draw a card.
Flavour: "Aww, Mazzy look it's us!" - Razra

Effect: At the start of your main phase, if there are six or more cards in your discard pile, gain 2$.
Flavour: "To see with eyes unclouded is a great gift indeed." - Taqren

Effect: Once per turn during your main phase, when you gain a charge, any ally draws a card.
Flavour: "In ancient times, we believed the future could be divined with bones. But the only future is the one we make." - Mazra

Effect: Once per turn during your main phase, you may reveal the top three cards of the nemesis deck. Return them in any order.
Flavour: "I can see so many colors!" - Claudia

Effect: When you cast a spell that costs 2$ or more, you may place it into any ally's hand instead of discarding it.
Flavour: "The mark of a true leader is understanding the strength of their comrades." - Soskel

Effect: Once per turn during your main phase, you may spend 9$ and suffer 1 damage to place a card in play from the nemesis deck on top of the nemesis deck.
Flavour: "Nameless are aether too. With enough control over it, one could theoretically accomplish anything!" - Claudia

Effect: Once per turn during your main phase, you may discard a card in hand. If you do, any ally draws a card and you may add a power token to a power in play.
Flavour: "Go now! I'll hold it off!" - Taqren

Effect: Once per turn during your main phase, when you play the second gem or relic that costs 4$ or more, deal 3 damage.
Flavour: "Most people can't understand the intricacies of relics." - Rhia

Effect: Add an additional level 1 treasure to your starting deck using the level 1 treasure rules. Your group can use an additional level 2 treasure.
Flavour: "Ooh! More goodies!" - Razra

Effect: At the start of your casting phase, you may lose 1 charge. If you do, return the next spell you cast during this casting phase to your hand instead of discarding it.
Flavour: "Time is a circle. Everything happens again and again." - Nook

Effect: When you play a relic that costs 3$ or more, deal 1 damage.
Flavour: "The armor cannot come off. It is my eternal shackle." - Thraxir

Effect: Once per turn, when you cast a spell that costs 5$ or less, you may discard a spell in hand to return the cast spell to your hand.
Flavour: "In Azer, mages learn to recycle their aether to maximize effectiveness while minimizing impact." - Ilya

Effect: At the start of your first turn of the game, focus one of your breaches three times.
Flavour: "I begin. I end. I begin again." - Thraxir

Effect: At the start of your first turn of the game, gain a gem from any supply pile.
Flavour: "It's a memento. It's not every day you get a free trip to the Void." - Kel

Effect: When you play a gem that costs 5$ or more, deal 2 damage.
Flavour: "Anything can be twisted into a weapon here." - Xaxos

Effect: Draw two cards from the level 1 treasure deck and add them to the Barracks. Add two additional level 1 treasures to your starting deck using the level 1 treasure rules.
Flavour: "Just because I live underground doesn't mean I'm above a shiny toy or two." - Ohat

Effect: When you gain a gem, Gravehold gains 1 life. This can cause Gravehold to have more than its maximum life.
Flavour: "A true hero rises above self interest. Do not worry if the story will be about you, simply ensure there are people left to tell it." - Taqren

Effect: When you focus or open a breach, you may cast any player's prepped spell. That spell deals 1 additional damage.
Flavour: "The tiniest stone can ripple through an entire lake." - Lucien

Effect: When you cast three or more spells during your casting phase, deal 3 damage.
Flavour: "The best defense is an unrelenting offense." - Reth

Effect: At the start of your main phase, if there are five or more cards in your discard pile, focus one of your closed breaches.
Flavour: "I proudly wear Xaxos's sigil. If Brama casts out anyone who pushes back, then let her cast me out too." - Z'hana

Effect: Once per turn during your main phase, you may discard a card in hand. If you do, deal 1 damage and gain 1 charge.
Flavour: "Like the stars, rise and set." - Sahala

Effect: When you play a relic that costs 4$ or more, any ally gains 1 charge.
Flavour: "You're welcome." - Rhia

Effect: At the end of your draw phase, if the total cost of spells in your hand is 6$ or more, draw a card.
Flavour: "What do you think, Rip? Doesn't it make me look fancy?" - Razra

Effect: Any number of Sparks may be prepped to your I breach.
Flavour: "Holding this, my mind feels clear. My fire...focused." - Lost

Effect: At the end of your draw phase, if the total cost of gems and relics in your hand is 7$ or more, draw a card.
Flavour: "The people of New Gravehold love their possessions. I didn't understand for a long time, but I think I am beginning to." - Qu

Effect: At the start of your first turn of the game, gain 2 charges. Once per game when the nemesis turn order card is drawn, you may lose 4 charges. If you do, skip the nemesis turn.
Flavour: "Nothing can turn back time. But all we need is a brief pause." - Cairna

Effect: At the start of your first turn of the game, gain 4$ that can only be used to gain a spell.
Flavour: "What a rush!" - Reth

Effect: Xaxos: Outcast deals 4 damage. Repeat this two more times.
Any player opens a breach, gains 2 charges, and gains 2 life.
Any player draws four cards and preps any number of spells in hand to their opened or closed breaches.
Xaxos: Outcast gains 8 life. This can cause Xaxos: Outcast to have more than his maximum life.#OR#Any player gains 6 life. This can cause that player to have more than their maximum life.
Shuffle any player's turn order card into the turn order deck. That player gains 2 life.#OR#Any player draws two cards and then destroys up to three cards in hand or discard pile.
Two players each return up to two cards in their discard piles to their hands.#OR#The player whose turn it is gains 10$.
Xaxos: Outcast discards a tier 1, 2, or 3 power in play.#OR#Any player gains two spells from any supply pile.
Any player casts a prepped spell without discarding it. Repeat this two more times.#OR#Two different players gain a gem that costs 5$ or less and places it into their hands.
Xaxos: Outcast discards a tier 1, 2, or 3 minion in play.#OR#Any player gains two relics from any supply pile and places those cards on top of their deck.
Deal 10 damage divided however you choose among any number of minions.#OR#Deal 15 damage to the nemesis.
The players collectively cast up to three prepped spells. Those spells deal 3 additional damage.#OR#Place up to two cards in the nemesis discard pile on top of the nemesis deck.

The players collectively cast up to four different prepped spells or spells in hand without discarding them. Those spells each deal 1 additional damage.#OR#The player collectively destroy up to five cards in hand or discard pile.

Reveal the top three cards of the nemesis deck. Return them in any order. Reveal the turn order deck. Return it in any order. Each player may prep up to two spells to their opened or closed breaches, ignoring occupancy rules.
